intro: Notothixos papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan sandalwood, is a rare and endemic species native to the highland regions of Papua, Indonesia. It is a small, evergreen tree characterized by its aromatic, fragrant wood and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces woody capsules as fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Notothixos papuanus is considered a valuable but endangered species in its native environment.
